description: A small urban site packed with possibilities: three towers, two mansion blocks, maisonettes, shops and cafes, green space and a school. Keybridge explores the heterogenous Vauxhall context to consider what the new urban vernacular might be.

factsheet.heading: The Tour
paragraphs: Beginning outside the old Tate Free Library (now South Lambeth Library) architects, Allies and Morrison, will share their approach to reinterpreting the contemporary mansion block and the challenges of designing tall buildings that remain contextual around South Lambeth Road. Touching on the varied uses within the development and the new setting created for the Vauxhall Griffin pub and St Anne and All Saints Church, that have enriched many aspects of life in the area and created a new piece of city.

images.title: St Anne and All Saints Church, South Lambeth Road

location.address: South Lambeth Library, 180 S Lambeth Road

name: Keybridge Walking Tour
